Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Log A is considered the primary timeline, but their timestamps might reflect when events are received rather than started. Log B has richer data but timestamps might differ by seconds or milliseconds. Some event names differ and there may be unmatched events.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Order Received (A) matches OrderReceived (B) based on similar event names and close timestamps (difference of 2 seconds).

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Order Validated (A) matches OrderValidation (B) based on similar event names and timestamp difference of 1 second.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Payment Processed (A) and PaymentCheck (B) have different names and a timestamp difference of 5 seconds, which exceeds the 2-second tolerance. They might represent different stages in the payment process and should not be merged.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Shipping (B) matches Item Shipped (A) based on similar event names and timestamp difference of 2 seconds.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Quality Check is an event in Log B that has no matching event in Log A.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - NE
Text: Since Log A timestamps might reflect when events were received rather than started, Log B timestamps could be more accurate for ordering merged events.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: The sequence of merged and unmerged events must be determined based on their actual timestamps. For merged events, use Log B's earlier timestamp when available to order events chronologically.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Item Delivered is an event in Log A that has no corresponding event in Log B, so it should be left as is.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: Events should be listed in chronological order, ensuring that merged events integrate attributes from both logs, and unmerged events retain their original source.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - NE
Text: When merging events, choose the earliest timestamp between the logs to determine its position in the timeline, but retain both timestamps as attributes when relevant for traceability.
